author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Brit teen awarded $1,500 after pizza box glued to his head
text:
A British teenager who was left with a bald spot after his cousin superglued a pizza box to his head was awarded $1,500.
Gregor Bowman, 19, took his cousin George Storrie to court on TV show Judge Rinder after the prank went viral.
And Rinder, who rules on small claims on his popular show, called Storrie "a moron" and ordered him to pay for personal injury and reputational damage.
Bowman said he woke up from a drunken night at a house party in Glasgow, Scotland, with the empty pizza box glued to his head.
Judge Rinder via YouTube George Storrie was unrepentant on the TV show Judge Rinder after he superglued a box to his cousin's head. A humiliated Bowman explained: “My girlfriend Chloe had to rip it off my head and it left a bald patch.
After the stunt was posted online, the footage has been viewed more than 75,000 times reported Mirror Online .
Rinder saud Bowman had suffered “personal injury” and “reputational damage”.
YouTube Gregor Bowman, 19, was awarded $1,500 in damages after having a pizza box superglued to his head. But he was unrepentant after the ruling and warned afterwards: "The next time he falls asleep it will be a lot worse.”
